victim.name: Kaelin Raze
victim.occupation: Neural Interface Engineer for Zenith Corp
victim.personality: Innovative and fiercely independent, Kaelin was known for pushing the boundaries of cybernetic enhancements and challenging corporate ethics.
victim.cause_of_death: Neural interface overload triggered by a rogue AI fragment embedded within an experimental brain-link implant, causing instantaneous cognitive collapse.

profile.name: Jax Arcturus
profile.description: A former colleague turned corporate spy, Jax is a cunning and resourceful hacker skilled in neural manipulation and data theft within the megatower's underbelly.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Ex-colleague and rival engineer competing for Zenith Corp's top projects.

original_mmo.means: Jax exploited his advanced hacking skills to remotely inject the rogue AI fragment into Kaelin's experimental brain-link implant, causing the neural interface overload that led to instantaneous cognitive collapse.
original_mmo.motive: Driven by rivalry and corporate espionage, Jax sought to eliminate Kaelin to secure control over Zenith Corp's most lucrative neural technology projects and undermine Kaelin's ethical stance against corporate overreach.
original_mmo.opportunity: Jax had covert access to the megatower's secure networks and was able to remotely breach Kaelin's brain-link systems during late-night hours when Kaelin was working alone in his private lab within the megatower.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: Jax exploited his advanced hacking skills to remotely inject the rogue AI fragment into Kaelin's experimental brain-link implant, causing the neural interface overload that led to instantaneous cognitive collapse.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Although Jax possessed advanced hacking skills, the rogue AI fragment was embedded via a highly specialized neural encryption protocol that Jax lacked clearance and technical capability to bypass remotely.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: Restricting Jax's ability to breach this specialized neural encryption weakens the plausibility that he remotely injected the fatal AI fragment.

profile.name: Lira Voss
profile.description: A high-ranking Zenith Corp executive, Lira is pragmatic and ruthless, often pushing for cutting-edge tech to advance corporate dominance at any cost.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Corporate overseer who frequently clashed with Kaelin over ethical boundaries.

original_mmo.means: Lira exploited her executive access to Zenith Corp's secure development networks to embed a malicious AI fragment within Kaelin's experimental brain-link implant, remotely triggering the neural interface overload that caused Kaelin's cognitive collapse.
original_mmo.motive: Lira aimed to eliminate Kaelin because Kaelin's ethical objections and refusals to comply with aggressive corporate agendas threatened Zenith Corp's profit-driven projects and Lira's ambitions for technological dominance.
original_mmo.opportunity: Lira had privileged access to Zenith Corp's labs and development timelines, allowing her to intervene during the implant's final testing phase when Kaelin was preparing for the neural interface trial within the secure megatower facility.

profile.name: Milo Fen
profile.description: An underground cybernetic activist advocating for open-source neural tech, Milo is idealistic and fiercely anti-corporate, operating in the shadows of the megatower.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Secret collaborator turned ideological adversary after Kaelin refused to support the activist cause.

original_mmo.means: Milo exploited his underground knowledge of neural tech to inject the rogue AI fragment into Kaelin's experimental brain-link implant, remotely triggering the neural interface overload that caused her cognitive collapse.
original_mmo.motive: After Kaelin repudiated their secret collaboration and refused to support the open-source neural activism cause, Milo saw her as a threat to his ideals and the movement, motivating him to eliminate her to prevent corporate-controlled technology from dominating.
original_mmo.opportunity: Milo gained access to Kaelin's neural implant during a covert meeting inside a maintenance shaft of the megatower, where security was lax and surveillance minimal, giving him the chance to introduce the malicious AI code unnoticed.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: Milo gained access to Kaelin's neural implant during a covert meeting inside a maintenance shaft of the megatower, where security was lax and surveillance minimal, giving him the chance to introduce the malicious AI code unnoticed.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Although Milo planned a covert meeting in the maintenance shaft, a sudden security lockdown forced all personnel, including Milo, to evacuate the megatower, preventing him from accessing Kaelin's neural implant at the critical time.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The forced evacuation and lockdown eliminate Milo's chance to tamper with the implant, invalidating his opportunity to commit the crime.

evidence_items.description: Logs from the megatower's secure network show multiple failed hacking attempts from Jax Arcturus's terminal during the time Kaelin's neural implant malfunctioned.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: These logs initially suggest Jax was actively trying to breach Kaelin's systems, implying he had the means, but actually reflect unsuccessful efforts blocked by specialized encryption.

evidence_items.description: Jax Arcturus was seen near the megatower's secure server access points late at night, coinciding with the timing of the neural interface overload incident.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: His physical proximity during the critical time creates suspicion about his opportunity, diverting attention despite his lack of means to bypass encryption remotely.

evidence_items.description: Logs from Zenith Corp's secure development network show Lira Voss accessing and modifying the codebase of Kaelin Raze's brain-link implant project shortly before the fatal trial.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This digital footprint proves Lira exploited her executive access to secretly implant malicious AI code that caused Kaelin's neural overload.

evidence_items.description: Internal emails reveal Lira expressing frustration and concern over Kaelin's refusal to support risky but highly profitable neural enhancement projects, showing clear intent to remove obstacles.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: These communications establish Lira's strong motive driven by Kaelin's ethical objections threatening corporate agendas and Lira's ambitions.

evidence_items.description: Security camera footage places Lira inside the Zenith Corp megatower's lab during the final testing phase of the neural implant, just hours before Kaelin's neural interface trial began.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The footage confirms Lira had the opportunity to tamper with the implant during its critical final testing stage within the secure facility.

evidence_items.description: Encrypted messages found on Milo Fen's personal comm device discussing plans for a secret meeting with Kaelin in the maintenance shaft, suggesting intent to access her neural implant.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: These messages imply Milo could have had a chance to tamper with Kaelin's implant, supporting his originally alleged opportunity before the lockdown intervention.

evidence_items.description: Handwritten notes found in Milo’s quarters expressing frustration over Kaelin’s rejection of their neural tech collaboration and her opposition to open-source activism.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The notes highlight Milo’s strong motive against Kaelin, making him appear suspicious.
